newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends mixed, nearbys sag late with CBOT.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends mixed, nearbys sag late with CBOT.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures settled mixed, with nearby contracts weak on harvest pressure and on late spillover pressure from CBOT grains and soybeans, traders said.
KCBT wheat had been higher at the midsession amid follow-through technical buying from Monday's rally and on spillover from gains in Minneapolis spring wheat.

Ongoing dry weather in North Dakota has raised concerns about lower spring wheat yield prospects. USDA Monday said the U.S. spring wheat crop as of Sunday was 69 percent good to excellent, against 72 percent the previous week.
"Minneapolis led the rally and now Chicago's leading the break," a KCBT trader said shortly before the close
KCBT wheat settled 2-1/4 cents per bushel lower to four cents higher, with July down 2-1/4 cents at $3.88-3/4.
Commission house Refco sold 1.4 million July bushels. Benson-Quinn bought 1.5 million December bushels.
